definition: to return with thanks/to give back (honorific)
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
surname Huan
to pay back/to return
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else

sentences.english: The National Institute of Culture praised the citizens who voluntarily returned the pieces.
sentences.chinese: 国家文化研究所表彰了那些自愿奉还文物的公民。

sentences.english: We sent the goods arrived, and then the shortage will be refund.
sentences.chinese: 货一到我们就会寄出，然后把余额奉还。

sentences.english: If anyone kills Cain, Cain shall be avenged sevenfold.
sentences.chinese: 任何人如果杀了该隐，该隐可以七倍奉还。

sentences.english: Mental suffering, even if I was ten times your money back, I would also like to replace the bear.
sentences.chinese: 心灵上痛苦，即使十倍的奉还于我，我也想代替承受。

sentences.english: If the players want to make it hard for me, I'm happy to make it twice as hard for them.
sentences.chinese: 如果球员给我难堪，我将很高兴的双倍奉还给他们。

sentences.english: Did you know that when you help someone, the help will be returned in two folds?
sentences.chinese: 你知道吗，你帮助别人，你的付出会双倍奉还。

definition: to return/to give back/to send back/to repatriate
to ask for sth back/to recover
to return sth/to hand back
both principal and interest/capital plus profit
return (a borrowed object) with thanks/decline (a gift) with thanks
to return something to its rightful owner
honorarium/gift as thanks
to write off at one stroke
to offer an apology/to make amends
(honorific) to give
to forget and not bear recriminations (idiom); to let bygones be bygones/There is no point in crying over spilt milk.
to apologize
to pay as charged
to be even/to be quits/to be even-steven
hard to forget even after one's teeth fall out (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
sticking unmoving to the original (idiom); not an iota changed/untouched
